snippet: A G.O.P. ad campaign has helped that party’s candidate against the Democrat in a contest to replace Thomas W. Libous, a Republican senator who resigned after a federal conviction.
abstract: Republican political outsider Fred Akshar's strong lead over Democrat Barbara Fiala in race to replace State Senator Thomas W Libous in New York's Southern Tier region underscores voters' exasperation with Albany and dampens hopes of Democrats who hope to gain rural districts in 2016; Libous is vacating seat in midst of corruption investigation, situation that has not improved Democrats' appeal.
lead_paragraph: A G.O.P. ad campaign has helped that party’s candidate against the Democrat in a contest to replace Thomas W. Libous, a Republican senator who resigned after a federal conviction.

headline.print_headline: Upstate Race to Replace Convicted Senator Shows Voters’ Anger at Albany
headline.main: Special New York Senate Race Shows Voters’ Anger at Albany
